name: lebua at State Tower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a 3 days stop in Bangkok and stayed at the Lebua in a Riverview Suite. Room was spacious. Bathroom very convenient et well furnished.
reviews.title: Great hotel, convenient situation

reviews.text: Attentive and effective service at the front desk.
reviews.title: Personalised service to your needs, feel like royalty yet reasonable rates.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From Bell Service to General Manager - they make you feel welcome and pamper you. Its in them and not just a standard procedure.
reviews.title: The best hotel experience I've ever had

reviews.text: The room views are to die for. Just look at their website. The breakfast food in the morning is great. Doesn't taste mass produced. Coffee, tea and chocolates in the room are all imported (verified with a Thai local).
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: The restaurant staff remember you. Excellent guest records of what you like, etc.
reviews.title: Highly Overrated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Absolutely brilliant hotel! If you are in Bangkok do not miss this hotel.
reviews.title: Lebua is fantastic

reviews.text: The best place to stay if you come to Bangkok!
reviews.title: Bangkok's Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Must check out their restaurants especially the famous "Sirroco" and "Sky Bar", both offer you the best food and view of Bangkok.
reviews.title: A Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed At Lebua State tower during Thai New Year. We were greeted at the airport and and driven to hotel in a hotel BMW. Driver did not give any information about city (usually hotel drivers do) as it took around 50 min to reach the hotel.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, great service and beautiful location

reviews.text: hotel was nice, but the entrance a little complicated. Lobby was small and dark but full of staff, so if you need a help they are all there for you. We booked a standard room with River View and were taken directly to the a suite (upgraded complimentary) on 55 floor. View was amazing.............., breathtaking. The only thing they will unlock the balcony after you sign a self security paper something like this.
reviews.title: Style and Comfort with a touch of warmth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loby is pretty small for a hotel of that size. The suroundings are a tipical Bangkok neighborhood so you go up in your luxurious room and look down ... you'll be staring at poverty. The hotel room are huge, there is a small living room with couches when you first get in, the comes the big bathroom and mini kitchen, and finally the bedroom. The kitchen has a fridge but no stove so you'll have to go out for food. DO NOT EAT AT THE HOTEL. I don't care how much money you have, it's a complete waste of money. Dinner at the Sky bar is 5000 bahts, that's more than what you would pay in the US. Instead, walk for about 2 min in any direction on Slolam and you'll have plenty of restaurants with meals at around 150 bahts. We eat several times at a restaurant called Maria's Pizza or something like that. It's a pizza house but they have very good Thai food, the best pad thai I' ve ever had, all for 150 bahts. Get out of the hotel, then turn right on the major road and keep walking until you see it on your right.
reviews.title: Big rooms

reviews.text: Make sure to get a massage while in Thailand. They run for about 300 to 400 bahts for 2 hours. DO NOT ask for a Thai massage unless you want to be biten up. I felt like I was in a wrestling match, absolutely brutal. Pay the extra money for an oil massage. Also if there are a few young laydies standing outside the shop waiting for costumers, you might get a happy ending at the end of your massage, so I would not recommend those places. Choose carefully.
reviews.title: Luxurious hotel in a great location
have to go there again
reviews.text: Use the Sky train to get around. Taxis are not a good option due to the traffic.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you get a taxi, make sure you tell them to use the meter, otherwise, you'll pay much more than what you were supposed to.
reviews.title: Spacious suites, excellent service & a delicious breakfast buffet!

reviews.text: If you go to the Grand Palace, do not listen to anyone telling you "it is closed right now and only open for Thai people". The Grand Palace is open every day. They will tell you that so that you get into a Tuk Tuk and drive to a different location. Also, you can't wear shorts at the grand palace.
reviews.title: Superb value

reviews.text: Suite was lovely. Comfy lounge area, small kitchenette, bathroom was large, with a bath and separate walk in power shower. Toiletries were Bulgari. Beds were very comfy, TV had so many channels, it was hard to choose.
reviews.title: 5* hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The view from the balcony was amazing. I only regret not going upto the top floor to see the view from there.
reviews.title: Amazing - truly the best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Travelled to many countries and continents, lived at cheap and at very posh hotels, but Lebua beats them all! Already by entering the well locatedhotel you feel taken care of. The staff is very friendly and professional. We were taken to the suite, that was litterly huge, a big bedroom´, bathroom and a very big lounge area. Not to forget are the two large balconies with great view of the city and the river. The bar upstairs is an attraction that you can not miss - offering a great view and excellent drinks, reasonably priced for the high quality. The breakfast is probably the best I have seen for many years, just a shame that we didnt get the early enough. Huge variety, including sushi :)
reviews.title: Amazing service!

reviews.text: All in all, we will be staying at this amazing hotel every time we travel to Bangkok!
reviews.title: Fabulous location, huge suites, great breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had such a great experience we stayed there twice. On our way to and again on our way back from our trip to Vietnam.
reviews.title: Just perfect!!!!!

aka: Lebua At State Tower Hotel Bangkok
description: lebua at State Tower is Bangkok's finest 5 star all suite hotel. With an undying passion to innovate and redefine hospitality at luxury city hotels in Thailand, lebua is more than a destination; it is a world-class experience. Enjoy the most opulent experiences at lebua at State Tower, Bangkok.
